mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our Mission is to fully recreate Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein at a 1:1 scale in the video game Minecraft. One block in Minecraft equals one meter. To achieve this almost impossible goal, anyone is able to join us as Builder and contribute to the largest and most expansive build project to ever have been attempted in Minecraft.

server.title: Our Server
server.description: Once you join our server network with the IP mc.alps-bte.com in the Minecraft version 1.12.2-1.17, you have two options: Either start building right away using the "Plot System" or visit already built areas by joining the "Terra Server". The "Plot System" is the easiest and fastest way to apply as an official Builder. If you are accepted into the Build Team as a Builder, you can build whatever you want on our open world "Terra Server".

how.title: How we do it
how.description: We use various publicly accessible geoinformation systems, LiDAR, 360 images and drone footage to recreate any structure with the highest degree of accuracy and detail as it is possible within Minecraft. Since building at off-angles is quite different from classic Minecraft building, we also have developed a large variety of tools to make it easier to get started. Furthermore, to overcome the Minecraft height limitation we use clever server side modifications like "Cubic Chunks".

gallery.title: Gallery
gallery.description: This page shows a collection of some of our building efforts. The content will be updated continuously. High resolution pictures for news coverage can be downloaded here as well.

downloads.title: Downloads
downloads.description: To support journalists in their work, we have made official press photos and information on Alps BTE available here for download. You are welcome to use this information for non-commercial publications without contacting us. Editorial use is permitted. In case of publication, we kindly request that a proof copy be sent to our press office.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Here you can find frequently asked questions about Alps BTE and the tools we use. If you have any questions that are not answered here, please contact us

application.title: Application
application.description: This is an overview on how to become a "Builder" - a member of our build team. For further information join our Discord. If you want an in-depth explanation on how to apply, watch our tutorial video down below.

discord.title: Discord
discord.description: We use Discord for coordinating the project and for communication between our members. Download the free messenger and join our Alps BTE Discord-Server by clicking here https://google.com. Read through the information channels to get used to the project and get in touch with our community.

plotSystem.title: Plot System
plotSystem.description: We use Discord for coordinating the project and for communication between our members. Download the free messenger and join our Alps BTE Discord-Server by clicking here (LINK). Read through the information channels to get used to the project and get in touch with our community.

applicationForm.title: Application Form
applicationForm.description: Go to https://buildtheearth.net/bte-alps, click "Apply" and fill out the form. Add the IDs of your constructed plots so that we can confirm you are able to build in BTE. For starting off we highly recommend our Builders Guide series on our YouTube channel which covers every aspect of building in BTE.

becomingBuilder.title: Becoming a Builder
becomingBuilder.description: Once you have sent off your form, it will be reviewed in less than 48 hours by one of our Reviewers. Meanwhile you can download the official Modpack - a modification of the game - that is crucial for building on the open-world "Terra Server". If you have been accepted into the team you get the "Builder" role and are now free to build wherever you want in Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Alps BTE is an independent subsidiary organisation of the Build The Earth project. It was founded in March 2020 and aims to recreate Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein at a 1:1 scale in the block game Minecraft.
